flags.title: User-Contributed Project
flags.text: This project guide is not managed by MAKE staff.

guide.introduction:
Gather materials

Mix a base coat color

Paint the base coat and let dry

Mix a contrasting woodgrain color

Paint the woodgrain design and let dry

Finish with clear topcoat
guide.introduction_rendered:
Gather materials

Mix a base coat color

Paint the base coat and let dry

Mix a contrasting woodgrain color

Paint the woodgrain design and let dry

Finish with clear topcoat

lines.text: Gather your materials: nail polish, nail polish remover, cotton swabs or rounds, a plastic lid for mixing polish colors.
lines.text_raw: Gather your materials: nail polish, nail polish remover, cotton swabs or rounds, a plastic lid for mixing polish colors.

lines.text: You will need a very thin brush to paint your woodgrain design.  A thin paintbrush will work, but many drugstores carry nail art kits that include interesting polish colors and very thin brushes.  I used the "Kiss" Nail Artist kit available at Walgreens, which came with a dark blue polish and thin brush.
lines.text_raw: You will need a very thin brush to paint your woodgrain design.  A thin paintbrush will work, but many drugstores carry nail art kits that include interesting polish colors and very thin brushes.  I used the "Kiss" Nail Artist kit available at Walgreens, which came with a dark blue polish and thin brush.

lines.text: Mix your base coat color.  I used white, orange and blue to make a light brown.
lines.text_raw: Mix your base coat color.  I used white, orange and blue to make a light brown.

lines.text: Paint the base coat and let it dry for a few minutes.
lines.text_raw: Paint the base coat and let it dry for a few minutes.

lines.text: Mix your contrasting color for the woodgrain design.  I used dark blue, orange and one drop of hot pink to offset the greenish tinge I was getting.
lines.text_raw: Mix your contrasting color for the woodgrain design.  I used dark blue, orange and one drop of hot pink to offset the greenish tinge I was getting.

lines.text: Now for the fun part!  Paint the woodgrain designs on each fingernail.  It helped me to look at examples of woodgrain while I was painting.
lines.text_raw: Now for the fun part!  Paint the woodgrain designs on each fingernail.  It helped me to look at examples of woodgrain while I was painting.

lines.text: The nail polish I mixed started to dry while I was painting, so try to work quickly.  You may have to mix another batch of color for your other hand.
lines.text_raw: The nail polish I mixed started to dry while I was painting, so try to work quickly.  You may have to mix another batch of color for your other hand.

lines.text: Painting with your non-dominant hand is a fun challenge!  Don't worry, irregular lines look like great, natural woodgrain.
lines.text_raw: Painting with your non-dominant hand is a fun challenge!  Don't worry, irregular lines look like great, natural woodgrain.

lines.text: Let the woodgrain pattern dry for a few minutes.
lines.text_raw: Let the woodgrain pattern dry for a few minutes.

lines.text: Apply a clear coat of polish.  This will protect your design from looking dull and chipping right away.
lines.text_raw: Apply a clear coat of polish.  This will protect your design from looking dull and chipping right away.

lines.text: Let your nails dry for at least 30 minutes before attempting any real woodworking.  Enjoy!
lines.text_raw: Let your nails dry for at least 30 minutes before attempting any real woodworking.  Enjoy!

guide.summary: You love wood, so why not give yourself a one of a kind woodgrain manicure?  Your custom faux bois (fake wood) design will turn heads and delight fellow crafters and makers.
guide.title: Wood Nails - A Faux Bois Manicure
